t: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
I*p waited patiently for the Lord;*s and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.
He*p brought me up also out of an horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock, and established my goings.
And*p he hath put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God: many shall see it, and fear, and shall trust in the Lord.*s
Blessed*p is that man that maketh the Lord*s his trust, and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.

Many,*p O Lord*s my God, are thy wonderful works which thou hast done, and thy thoughts which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order unto thee: if I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered.
Sacrifice*p and offering thou didst not desire; mine ears hast thou opened: burnt offering and sin offering hast thou not required.
Then*p said I, Lo, I come: in the volume of the book it is written of me,
I*p delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart.
I*p have preached righteousness in the great congregation: lo, I have not refrained my lips, O Lord,*s thou knowest.
I*p have not hid thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truth from the great congregation.
Withhold*p not thou thy tender mercies from me, O Lord:*s let thy lovingkindness and thy truth continually preserve me.
For*p innumerable evils have compassed me about: mine iniquities have taken hold upon me, so that I am not able to look up; they are more than the hairs of mine head: therefore my heart faileth me.
Be*p pleased, O Lord,*s to deliver me: O Lord,*s make haste to help me.
Let*p them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that wish me evil.
Let*p them be desolate for a reward of their shame that say unto me, Aha, aha.
Let*p all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: let such as love thy salvation say continually, The Lord*s be magnified.
But*p I am poor and needy; yet the Lord thinketh upon me: thou art my help and my deliverer; make no tarrying, O my God.
